Module schiffeversenken
Package de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine

Class GUIContext

java.lang.Object
de.uniluebeck.itm.schiffeversenken.engine.GUIContext
Direct Known Subclasses:
AWTGUIContext
public abstract class GUIContext extends Object
GUIContext This class provides an abstraction to the OS windowing subsystem.
Author:
leondietrich

  • Constructor Details

    • GUIContext

      public GUIContext(String windowtitle)
      Construct a new GUI context
      Parameters:
      windowtitle - The window title to produce (if applicable)

  • Method Details

    • getCanvas

      public abstract Canvas getCanvas()
      This method must provide a canvas object suitable to paint on the window.
      Returns:
      The canvas object.

    • performPaintOperation

      public abstract void performPaintOperation()
      This method shall be called after everything has been drawn. It should take care of swapping the buffers so that the user can see what has been rendered.

    • destroy

      public abstract void destroy()
      Call this method in order to destroy the gui objects.

    • setup

      public abstract void setup()
      This method gets called when it is time to display the game.

    • loadTile

      public abstract Tile loadTile(String filePath)
      Use this method in order to load a tile in a way suitable for the current gui context.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The file to load. This may be a relative path.
      Returns:
      The loaded tile.

    • setResolution

      public abstract void setResolution(int width, int height)
      Set the graphics resolution. Don't call this while drawing. I've warned you.
      Parameters:
      width - The width to set to
      height - The height to set to

    • getResolution

      public abstract Vec2 getResolution()
      Use this method in order to obtain the current resolution.
      Returns:
      The resolution as a Vec2 object.

    • setInputDebugModeEnabled

      public void setInputDebugModeEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Use this method in order to enable or disable input debugging. When input debugging is enabled the context logs incoming mouse and keyboard actions.
      Parameters:
      enabled - The new value to set the flag to.

    • isInputDebuggingEnabled

      public boolean isInputDebuggingEnabled()
      Use this method in order to check if input debugging is enabled.
      Returns:
      The current status of the flag.

    • getMouseCursorLocation

      public abstract Vec2 getMouseCursorLocation()
      Use this method in order to obtain the current mouse cursor location. Please note that they might be negative or greater than the canvas itself as the context might be windowed.
      Returns:
      The coordinates of the mouse relative to the canvas.
